## Basic Information about "Chłopi"

Władysław Reymont's best-known work is the award-winning four-volume novel Chłopi (The Peasants). In 1924 he was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature for this work.

## Writing Timeline

In 1900, Reymont was severely injured in a railway accident, which halted his writing career until 1904 when he published the first part of Chłopi. He partly wrote Chłopi between 1901 and 1908, and the novel was published in installments in years 1902–1908 in "Tygodnik Ilustrowany", and published in book form in years 1904–1909 in Warsaw.

## Structure and Content

The novel is divided into four parts: Autumn, Winter, Spring, Summer. The novel shows the life of a community inhabiting the village of Lipce over the course of four seasons.
